definition: to wear out (clothes)/to pierce (a membrane etc)
to wear/to put on/to dress/to bore through/to pierce/to perforate/to penetrate/to pass through/to thread
broken/damaged/worn out/lousy/rotten/to break, split or cleave/to get rid of/to destroy/to break with/to defeat/to capture (a city etc)/to expose the truth of

sentences.english: Fashion wears out more apparel than the man.
sentences.chinese: 服裝過時的多，穿破的少。

sentences.english: DFashion wears out more apparel than the man.
sentences.chinese: 服裝過時的多，穿破的少。

sentences.english: Helga threw away that dress because she had worn it out.
sentences.chinese: 海爾格的那件衣服已經穿破扔了。

sentences.english: She will not stop wearing her clothes until it has a hole in it.
sentences.chinese: 她要把一件衣服穿破才肯去買新衣服。

sentences.english: This is the third pair of '.
sentences.chinese: 這是你今年穿破的第三雙鞋子。

sentences.english: Results All of the 10 batches of samples share a high similarity.
sentences.chinese: 結果10批紅穿破石藥材指紋圖譜之間的相似度較高。

sentences.english: Better wear out shoes than sheets .
sentences.chinese: 穿破鞋子，勝於磨破牀單。

sentences.english: The worn shoes can be renovated and look like new ones.
sentences.chinese: 穿破的鞋可以修理得像新的一樣。

sentences.english: Weaving through the forests , breaking through the clouds.
sentences.chinese: 穿過茂密的森林，穿破厚厚的雲層。

sentences.english: I'll-e worn holes in all my socks.
sentences.chinese: 我把我所有的襪子都穿破了。

sentences.english: The blast forms a slug of molten metal that can rip through most armoured vehicles—and their occupants.
sentences.chinese: 爆炸以後形成的金屬嵌片可以穿破裝甲車輛。

definition: to cut open/to rip/to streak across (lightning, meteor etc)/to pierce (scream, searchlight etc)
to cleave/to split open/to spread open (fingers, legs)
tear or rupture/to have a tear (e.g. in one's clothes)/without restraint (e.g. of swearing)
